> Can you explain to me how being sexist against all men solves Riot's sexism problem?

This is a straw man - you're addressing a claim no one made.

> Do men just have a free ticket into games or something? How is the problem any different for women and "non binary" people?

Yes, men have a massive advantage in getting into games. There is no other explanation for why a conservative 75% of people in game development are men, with even higher percentages for executive roles and jobs seen as more "engineering"-focused.

Women and non-binary people have different problems because they have different experiences.

> If a man wants to get into games why isn't he allowed in the room?

The events in the room are "to support women and non-binary folks." Men simply aren't the target audience.

If a doctor has an appointment to try and help a patient with a health problem they're having, it's not an attack on anyone else when the doctor takes that patient into a private room to talk about their issues. Other people can have health problems too... and they can see other doctors, or even the same doctor at different times - they don't have a _right_ to get into that room, too.

It's about them banning men, this is blatant sexism. If it were the opposite, and it was a men only room because "women aren't the target audience, and wouldn't be interested in it" there would be uproar. I fail to see how this is any different. They are just ostracizing a large portion of the community, simply for a PR stunt.
I agree with you except for saying that this is 'worse' sexism. I don't know if you were trying to gatekeep sexism but it comes off as you trying to invalidate rape claims or blatant work sexism.
